questions.question: Do you have a courtyard, garden, or a farm?
How much do you like sweeping the courtyard?
validation: serisouly no I'm not playing here

questions.question: Do you want a fruiting tree?
On a scale of 1-10, how much do you like citrus?
Are you an awesome cool person?
How many pigs do you own?
Is there a river on your property?

results.name: Curry leaf tree
results.description: A small tree that's great for courtyards, from which leaves can be picked and added to any curry!

results.name: Bay tree
results.description: A robust small tree with small, fragrant, dark green leaves that are great for use in stews and curries.

results.name: Frangipani
results.description: The marker of any gentrified inner-Sydney suburb. You'll have beautiful flowers all summer long!

results.name: Plum blossom
results.description: Has delicate pink flowers in spring, and is less effort to look after than a Frangipani.

results.name: Coconut palm
results.description: A tall tree that drops dangerously oversized drupes onto people's heads.

results.name: Apple tree
results.description: The most basic and popular fruit tree!

results.name: Feijoa tree
results.description: King of fruits, fruit of kings! Feijoas are the best fruit.

results.name: Orange tree
results.description: Is the fruit named for the colour or the colour named for the fruit?

results.name: Kaffir lime
results.description: 2 for the price of 1. Leaves are great in curries and stir fry, but also grows limes!

results.name: Lemon tree
results.description: The most prodigious fruiter of all the citrus!

results.name: Eucalyptus
results.description: Australia's favourite, this dangerously flammable tree is home to the national animal: The Drop Bear.

results.name: Walnut tree
results.description: A nut shaped like a miniature brain grows from this tree!

results.name: Hazel
results.description: Used for nutella and salads, and even known to habour truffles on the roots!

results.name: Oak
results.description: The acorns are a tasty treat for pigs, and truffles can be grown on the roots!

results.name: Willow
results.description: A mysterious tree that loves water, mist, and witches.

results.name: Birch
results.description: A bland pretty tree, suitable for someone who says no to everything!
